name: Pope Bl. Innocent V
summary: Innocent V, born Pierre de Tarentaise, was Pope for only about five months in 1276. He was a Dominican friar and theologian before becoming pope. He worked to reconcile the Greek and Latin Churches and attempted to organize a crusade. He was known for his learning and piety. His brief pontificate prevented him from implementing many of his plans. He is venerated as Blessed in the Catholic Church.
